problemStatement.plain: Maximum intersecting family of k-subsets of n-set has size C(n-1,k-1) for n ≥ 2k.

knowledge.progressSummary: COMPLETED: 231 lines, 3 axioms. Katona's cyclic permutation proof approach. Star bound achieved.
builtItems: ErdosKoRado.IsIntersectingFamily - predicate for intersecting k-set families
ErdosKoRado.Star - family of all k-sets containing fixed element x
ErdosKoRado.cyclicInterval - consecutive k elements in cyclic order
ErdosKoRado.star_is_intersecting - PROVED: star families are intersecting
ErdosKoRado.star_card - star has exactly C(n-1,k-1) elements
ErdosKoRado.erdos_ko_rado_bound - main theorem (with axiom for double counting)
insights: Katona's proof uses cyclic permutations to avoid induction
Key double-counting: count pairs (S, σ) where S ∈ A is cyclic interval in σ
At most k consecutive intervals can pairwise intersect in any cyclic order
Mathlib's Set.Intersecting and Shadow infrastructure useful but not directly applicable
mathlibGaps: Double counting formalization for cyclic permutations
Cyclic order theory (permutations as cyclic arrangements)
nextSteps: Prove double counting lemma to remove main axiom
Add uniqueness: equality iff family is a star
